text: today I am making something you are all
going to go insane over it's a triple
chocolate cheesecake and you start off
by making the first of the triple the
chocolate crust I have one package or
nine ounces of chocolate wafer cookies
into a food processor you don't you can
break them up just a little bit so they
grind more evenly and then grind them up
sometimes cookie crumb crusts have salt
or sugar or other ingredients like that
this one does not it's just the crumbs
and some butter to the cookie crumbs add
six tablespoons of melted unsalted
butter pulse until it holds together
then dump your crumb mixture into a nine
by three inch springform pan then you
want to press the crumbs evenly into the
bottom and I would say about an inch and
a half up the sides of the pan to make
the crust I like to use the bottom of a
dry measuring cup to get a nice even
pack get your oven preheating to 325
degrees because you're going to want to
put this into the oven right away
press it down really nicely and firmly
and against the sides as well then you
want to put it on a rimmed baking sheet
and then get into the oven until it's
set about ten minutes all right
I'm just placing this on a piece of foil
because I'm going to wrap the bottom of
the pan and foil in a few minutes but
first I'm going to make my filling
here I have four packages of cream
cheese it's a lot but it makes a huge
and fantastic cheesecake so four
packages room temperature to that add
one and a half cups of sugar 1/2
teaspoon of salt blend that together
once it starts coming together and it's
all blended together then you can add
your eggs it's four large eggs through
the feed to with the machine run awesome
Oh big lump of cream cheese on the side
of my ball I'm glad I checked if you
don't have a food processor that's this
big you can do this in your standing
mixer if you have a standing mixer or by
handy but when your eggs are added add
your sour cream it's 1 cup of sour cream
one last thing the chocolate eight
ounces of melted semi-sweet chocolate no
matter what you use to beat this
together if it's the food processor or a

very smooth this is something else you
guys
all right that's it it can get poured
right into the crust whoa right in here
get every last a bit into your pan it's
going to come up over the crust so don't
worry about that that's normal now I
want to cook this in a water bath so I
have a roasting pan here and I'm going
to take my cake pan and place it in the
roasting pan if your springform pan is
getting a little bit old it might be
getting a little loose sometimes a
little bit of water gets in there so
this ensures that does not happen have
your oven preheating to 325 it should
still be at 325 from baking your crust
and then bring it over to the stove in
order to fill it with the water at the
stove the ovens at 325 degrees
you want to fill with the water at the
oven so it doesn't spill all over the
place so put your soon-to-be cake in the
oven and then fill with boiling water
about halfway up the sides of the pan
cook it for 1 hour at 325 turn the oven
off and leave it in the oven for another
hour before removing it when the cake
comes out of the oven run a knife around
the edge to loosen it from the sides but
keep it in the pan put it on a wire rack
to cool until it's like room temperature
about an hour and then get it into the
refrigerator until it's totally cold
that can take up to overnight cooling it
in the pan just helps keep it together
comes out really beautifully get it onto
whatever you're going to serve it on let
me use a cake stand I think this
deserves a cake stand don't you
it is very impressive this ganache I
made by bringing half a cup of heavy
cream to a boil and then pouring it over
four ounces of chopped semi-sweet
chocolate probably want to let it cool
just a little bit before you put it on
top of your cake but if your cake is
nice and cool they can I should set
really quickly and then just spread it
over the top haha this is out of control
